intro: Mogiphanes virgata, commonly known as the slender thorned acacia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features straight, thorny stems and bipinnate leaves with small, rounded leaflets. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Mogiphanes virgata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savanna and thicket habitats.
